meanings.definition: Easily disturbed or drawn away from what one is doing
meanings.sent1: The students in the noisy classroom were very distractable during the test.
meanings.sent2: She is distractable when there are too many things happening around her.
meanings.sent3: The distractable puppy chased after every moving object in the park.
meanings.sent4: His distractable mind wandered like a lost balloon in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The distractable toddler's attention jumped from toy to toy like a playful kitten.

meanings.definition: Capable of being easily distracted or diverted from a task
meanings.sent1: The distractable child kept looking out the window instead of focusing on homework.
meanings.sent2: Being distractable can sometimes make it hard to finish projects on time.
meanings.sent3: The distractable squirrel forgot where it buried its nuts and searched frantically.
meanings.sent4: Her distractable nature was like a magnet pulling her away from important work.
meanings.sent5: The distractable driver missed the turn because they were too busy looking at their phone.
